body.p: Most lessees that predominantly lease property supported such an approach, as did some users of financial statements that analyse entities that predominantly lease property. In the view of those lessees and users, recognising lease expenses for property leases on a straight-line basis reflects the nature of the transaction. For example, some noted that, when a lessee enters into a typical five-year lease of retail space, the lessee is simply paying to use the retail space rather than consuming any of the value of the underlying asset. In their view, a lessee should recognise these rentals on a straight-line basis.
